intro: Borreria pusilla, commonly known as dwarf borreria, is a small, herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Borreria pusilla is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants.
